title: Scenario: Accessing the Settings menu from the main tabs
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
AND the user is logged in
AND the user has navigated to the Today tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Settings button from the top right
custom_expected: THEN, the user is taken to the settings page

title: Scenario: The back button on Settings
custom_preconds: GIVEN the user has launched the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user accesses the settings menu
custom_expected:
THEN, there will be a back button on the top left
AND tapping the back button will take user back to the Today tab

title: Scenario: The MLB Account button
custom_preconds: Given the user has accessed the Settings menu

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the MLB Account button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN, the user is taken to the MLB Account page
AND the user will see their email and password populated in the fields
AND there will be a Privacy Policy link 
AND there will be a Forgot Password? button
AND there will be a Log Out button between forgot password and privacy policy

title: Scenario: The Favorite Team button
custom_preconds: Given the user has accessed the Settings menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Favorite Team button
custom_expected: Then the user will be brought to the Teams page index

title: Scenario: The Terms & Conditions button
custom_preconds: Given the user has accessed the Settings menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Terms & Conditions button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be brought to the Terms & Conditions page
and the user will see an 'Back' button at the top left
and tapping the 'Back' button will bring the user back to the Settings page

title: Scenario: Tapping the Privacy Policy link in the MLB Account page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the MLB Account button
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Privacy Policy link
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the Privacy Policy page
and the user will see an Back button on the top left
and tapping that button will bring the user back to the MLB Account page

title: Scenario: Tapping the Forgot Password? link in the MLB.com Account page
custom_preconds:
Given the user has accessed the Settings menu
and the user taps on the MLB.com Account button
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Forgot Password? link
custom_expected:
Then the user displayed with the password reset modal
and the user will see a field to enter their MLB.com email address into
and the user will see an 'Account' page the background
and only tapping back button on a device will bring the user back to the MLB.com Account page, can't dismiss password reset modal otherwise.

title: Scenario: The FAQ button
custom_preconds: Given the user has accessed the Settings menu
custom_steps: When the user taps on the FAQ button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be taken to the FAQ page
and the user will see a 'Back' button at the top left
and tapping the 'Back' button will bring the user back to the Settings menu

title: Scenario: The contact Us button
custom_preconds: Given the user has accessed the settings menu
custom_steps: When the user taps the contact Us button
custom_expected:
Then the user will be presented with a confirmation pop up ("You will be leaving Ballpark")
And there will be a cancel and an Ok button

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the cancel button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
The pop up message is dismissed 
and the user will remain on the settings page

custom_steps_separated.content: when the user taps the Ok button
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user will then be taken to the MlB.com contact website.

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the MLB.com contact us website
and the user taps the device back button.
custom_steps_separated.expected: the user is then returned to the Ballpark app Settings page.
